website_summaries.verdict: The Fujifilm X-T1 is a great camera for advanced photographers as long as its quirks don't bother you.
pros: The stunning viewfinder, comfy grip and plethora of direct controls makes the Fujifilm X-T1 a joy to shoot with, plus the image quality is great and the continuous-shooting is among the best in its class
cons: Some of the controls are too hard to manipulate, its general performance doesn't stand out, and the movie quality disappoints

customer_reviews.title: Love fuji, sold canon and Ive never looked back
customer_reviews.text: Sold my canon 5D mark III and all the expensive canon lenses to get into the Fuji system and have NEVER looked back. From the lightweight camera body to fast, smaller lenses very well made out of metal I have never been more pleased with my natural looking images. Fuji has a way of determining color, and unlike the constant need in canon to rework my RAW images....these are natural and look so much nicer right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: denny_sf

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things about this camera
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this camera. I love the perfect blend of old school tactile dials, combined with cutting edge technology. It is awesome to be able to quickly flip through shutter speeds, iso's, and aperatures (on the lens, not body), without having to go into 462 different submenus like on so many digital cameras these days. I have it paired with the fuji 35mm f/1.4, and I couldn't be happier with the combo
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, SLR killer. makes photography fun again. Brings back the passion and art of photography.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. manual controls are awsome, Focus is fast with lots of great manual focus tools so you can use your old cameras manual focus lenses. The fuji XT-1 makes photography fun again, the first digital camera that bring back the passion of photography. Good in low light, very good easy to access manual controls. Fuji is always updating the firmware making a great camera even better. The 32,000 electronic shutter speed is very useful. This is a Cannon or Nikon DSLR killer. Fare lighting and smaller. has incredibly great out of camera JPG and RAW imagery. All the Fuji XF glass has awesome IQ, including the lense that comes with the camera, no junk lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Airglider1

customer_reviews.title: Best camera out there for the price/quality balance
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have already said it all. This is an excellent camera. I love it's size and I've really enjoyed using vintage lenses on it like 44-2 Helios and Asahi Takumar 50mm get an adapter and these old lenses are so cool with this camera. The fujinon lenses are badass too I have the 16mm f1.4 and the 35mm f2 they're both amazing.
customer_reviews.author: CoronaphyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact package
customer_reviews.text: Awesome compact package. The kit lenses, the 35mm lens, compact flash and compact travel tripod make a super carry anywhere combination in my book. The camera is not set up for sports with the electronic viewfinder but handles all other tasks with ease. The Xtran sensor puts out great jpg from the camera and the continued firmware upgrades absolutely sell the camera. The firmware (4th major upgrade) have completely changed the auto focus for the better and have added features. Canon and Nikon take note..... Not quite a replacement for a full frame DSLR in my book but REALLY close. Very have with the camera and lens!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Long time Nikon shooter has a new love.
customer_reviews.text: Had instant buyer's remorse when I placed the order. Planned to return it when it was received. Package arrived and I figured I should try it before I returned it. It's NOT going back. What a nifty little camera. Plcture quality outstanding. Great dynamic range and detail. Accurate color. Easy to adjust settings, even in auto mode. The 18-55mm kit lens is way more than any kit lens can expect to be. I upgraded firmware on both body and lens from Fujifilm site. Easy job. Purchased Rico Pfirstinger's book on the X-T1 and I'm off on a journey to learn how to get best results here. Highly recommended., A YUGE bargain on close-out now because of the new X-T2.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: So happy
customer_reviews.text: My first serious exploration into semi-pro digital photography equip after feeling a bit burned on 35mm & medium format acquisitions circa 2000. Have not been able to put this camera down, and have yet to find myself in a situation where I wish I had more. A few strips of gaffers tape makes this camera nearly invisible, making it ideal for travel to unpredictable parts of the world. I swore I would stick to prime lenses when I purchased this camera, but find myself waiting for a mid-telephoto to full telephoto lens in the mail at the time of this review. Excited to capture life's noteworthy moments with this camera over the coming years!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Benetti

customer_reviews.title: love the EVF and manual controls
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Canon T4i setup (including several -L and prime lenses). The mexapixels are lower, but I actually take this with me and use it. I'm confident in the weather sealing, love the EVF and manual controls. After using an EVF versus an Optical viewfinder, I'm in love with what you can do (focus peaking, info, preview, over-bright, etc.). Excellent lens lineup (I own the 18-135mm WR, 56mm, 35mm WR) If I had to slight the package, I would only say that the Fuji XF lens lineup is missing two things: 56mm with weather sealing and a 70-200 f/2.8 (I'm aware of the 50-140, but would like the longer reach).
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: best inter-changeable lenses you can imagine
customer_reviews.text: Owned and used this camera for almost 1/2 a year. Used Canon, Fujifilm and Panasonic high end for the past 8 years. I am committed to Fujifilm now. Started with X100, and now I exclusively use the X-T1. Fast, accurate, best inter-changeable lenses you can imagine. Fantastic color rendition, especially for people. Discreet. Weather sealed. Traditional. You need to think to use this camera, but not cumbersome. All necessary buttons on outside. A traditional, thinkers camera perfectly suited for the modern, digital mind-set. Buy it - you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pahl

customer_reviews.title: Portable, powerful, stylish.
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome, awesome camera. I purchased a Pentax K-3 last year as my first foray into the APS-C sensor market, and to be frank, I absolutely adored it but it was so bulky I found myself using it about 98% of the time at home. I wanted a camera that was beautiful and rugged like the Pentax, but with a smaller form factor. The X-T1 fits that bill perfectly. It's hard to describe, but after using it for a few weeks (with the 35 1.4 lens), it just feels *right* in the hands. It's also quite the conversation piece with its retro stylings. Looks like I've been converted to Fuji!
customer_reviews.author: T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: a fine choice
customer_reviews.text: Good writeups in camera magazines convinced me to try this new offering from Fujifilm. I like manual control and find the dials on this camera very easy to understand and use. My current camera has all the same options for shutter speed, aperture, ISO, and manual focus but the chaneges are menu driven which slows my ability to adjust. I'm selling my (otherwise very nice) Panasonic and keeping this one for the easy adjustment of important parameters.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart G Hoar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera and Gear
customer_reviews.text: Great price, all the bells and whistles this begging (so far 4 years in the making) photographer need to step up his game. Now when I take shots I get a lot compliments on the gear I use to do so.
customer_reviews.author: William Davis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as present for my son and he loves it. He’s try to build a business for himself and so far it’s working great.
customer_reviews.author: Angela C.

customer_reviews.title: Best mirrorless camera ever made
customer_reviews.text: I know the title might be a hyperbole, but I really love the way this camera is designed like the old slr’s and built with strong materials. I am glad I purchased this particular used one as I saved a lot of money and it was in a very good condition everything working great.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandros Veizis

customer_reviews.title: Very beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera all around. Didnt give five stars because it came with no flash.
customer_reviews.author: Tarikrobertson

customer_reviews.title: Decent introduction to FujiX
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid pick for anyone curious about mirrorless cameras and/or the FujiX line. The newer models have much more improved autofocus in low light with movement, but this still did good enough job before I upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fuji Convert!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera... it has the shutter speed dial where it's supposed to be, it's easy to handle, not overly big, and I got it for a sweet deal. What more can you say! I'm a Fuji convert!
customer_reviews.author: fotostuf

customer_reviews.title: We LoVe it!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the X-T1 for our photography Business. We love it !! As with the other Fuji X bodies we use the images are super sharp! No it's not as fast as my Big Nikon D700. but it blows away everything when it comes to image quality and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Tamashii

customer_reviews.title: Fuji Xt1 made me enjoy photography more.
customer_reviews.text: Fuji Xt1 made me enjoy photography more. Thank you Amazon warehouse, the item was as described.
customer_reviews.author: HelloKT

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy with nearly everything about this camera
customer_reviews.text: I sold all my Canon gear to purchase a smaller, lighter, mirrorless camera. I'm so happy with nearly everything about this camera. I love the size and weight. For my arthritic hands, the decrease in size and weight has been helpful. I appreciate the functionality also. Having dials for many of the functions (ISO, Shutter, bracketing, metering mode) is convenient and easy to learn. My habits, left over from my Canon days, are quickly adjusting to the new position and function of buttons and settings.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McNaught

customer_reviews.title: Not a Toy!
customer_reviews.text: Superb finish and a serious photography tool. This camera does almost everything one could ask for. It has few limitations, like no built in HDR, that are easy to get around using manual techniques. Both jpg and raw files are excellent. Highly recommend this camera if you are looking for a long term investment for a photography tool.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin P. Bodo

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this camera he is a budding photographer ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this camera he is a budding photographer and is so excited about all of the options he his using his new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera. Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking pictures for a long time. In the early days the light meter was not part of the camera. I picked up this camera and knew how to use it without reading the manual! They took the controls out of endless menus and put then on the camera! Most cameras, these days, take good pictures ... If you know what to point it at. This camera is all about the process of taking pictures. It is very good. Nice it is weather resistant. Some lenses are also, but not all. The kit lense is so so. I got the 35mm f2 lense and put the kit lense away. Enclosed is a picture from Ft Ticonderoga.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It can do sports but not as easily as the DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Coming from the Canon DSLR camp and my share of L Glass, I'm impressed. It can do sports but not as easily as the DSLR. Everything else is amazing. From its build to its top notch native glass. There really is nothing lacking for most photographers. Now add it's portability and ability to grab images you wouldn't think of or try due to the DLRS size, gotta love it... Haven't left Canon completely but sure seems like we might be heading that way.
customer_reviews.author: David V

customer_reviews.title: Very good system, considering that I'm coming from a Leica ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good system, considering that I'm coming from a Leica M9. Gets a little bulky if you add a vertical battery grip (with extra battery) and some of Fuji's larger lenses (and lens hoods), but you get the same quality at 1/3 the cost. With the XT-1 body only, fitted with a pancake 27mm, you can keep your 'stealth' status in tack!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera still today.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice 👍🏾 this camera makes me get up and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: R.J

customer_reviews.title: Film feel in a digital camera
customer_reviews.text: Has been a great camera so far. Fun to play with and the color science of Fuji’s is beautiful. They always nail the film feel in a digital
customer_reviews.author: Dylon Harbottle

customer_reviews.title: ... for years and it has proven to be even better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've been eyeballing this camera for years and it has proven to be even better than expected. It came in pristine condition and works as it should. Shipping took a couple of weeks, but it was well worth the wait! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: kelsey barr

customer_reviews.title: Help me
customer_reviews.text: Won’t allow me to take picture if anyone can help my email is jurellvelez25@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Jurell Velez

customer_reviews.title: Charger Issue
customer_reviews.text: The Kastra Micro Charger is always glowing green and the battery is not charging. This is not necessarily negative on the camera itself, but how can I fix this?
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: So much fun to shoot
customer_reviews.text: So much fun to shoot. Focus peaking is the future and I wish my Nikon D 600 had it as I like it better than auto focus. If you have large hands I would buy the battery pack for ease of holding.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Rembisz

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera and it's tiny form factor compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera and it's tiny form factor compared to DSLRs. Very easy to use and a familiar interface having used SLR film cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb camera with superlative lenses available
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to add to the numerous reviews - just a great camera. It's 98.9% of my old Nikon D700 at a weight suitable for long backpack trips. The fast Fuji lenses have equaled their Nikkor counterparts in terms of image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Pack

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Just as described only no flash in the box. Otherwise great condition as described
customer_reviews.author: Aljohani Tareq M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera with a large selection of high quality lenses ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera with a large selection of high quality lenses available. Great for everything with the possible exception of fast action sports.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoShooter

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm X-T1 and amazing oldie to try.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is old, but the quality is absolutely amazing, I am taking pictures even with analogue lense and it makes a perfect match you can check on my Ig @estefaniaagussi
customer_reviews.author: Estefania Agussi

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera and the view finder is truly amazing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the X-T1 as a daily usage camera when I do not want to lug around my Canon professional series equipment. We are retired and traveling the country in our RV, taking thousands of pictures. After using this camera for over six months I find I hardly ever break out my Canon equipment any more. This is the finest professional grade camera I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Jo B

customer_reviews.title: A sweet Gem, a beauty
customer_reviews.text: A sweet Gem, a beauty, a precision instrument of creativity with the DNA of photography in its soul. An EVF that is BETTER than an optical viewfinder, ergonomics and menu options that inspire, and a family of lenses that are razor sharp, have low to zero distortion, and are not overpriced like so many of the other brands are.
customer_reviews.author: Mod_Max

customer_reviews.title: Fuji is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I love Fuji. I have never had a fuji before but after my experiences with my Fuji camera (graphite XT1) and their amazing Fuji lenses, I will always have one!
customer_reviews.author: dcdirector

customer_reviews.title: Superb Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is without doubt a great camera. The Nikon D300s was also one of my favorites but I think the X-T1 has the edge in size and picture quality. My only complaint is with Amazon I purchased the camera through Amazon although the X-T1 appeared NEW I believe it was a returned camera the box showed ware & tare and the serial No. had been covered. The X-T1 functions as new and does not have the light leak problem, I have since purchased 3 lenses which are all of superb quality and build.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Walker

customer_reviews.title: So far so good I own both the XE1-XE2
customer_reviews.text: So far so good I own both the XE1-XE2, I sold all of my canon DSLR stuff this is my new gear that I will be using for all of my photography. With the new firmware update this camera is a beast. This is one if my first shots with it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than full size DSLRs
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a smallish camera with full features. Excellent build and picture quality. Unless your a pro, this is more camera than you'll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good Hiking Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by this camera. Superb color and clearness. Gladly dumped my Cannon 50D for this lightweight beauty. I'm a backpacker and the lower weight without loss of quality is a deal maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chambers

customer_reviews.title: flexible and fun. Beautiful colors and good low light performance
customer_reviews.text: Fast, flexible and fun. Beautiful colors and good low light performance. I love having quick access to settings. Looking forward to shooting with some of the fast prime glass. Saving my pennies.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: The pictures are stunning and the camera is very light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first semi-professional camera. The pictures are stunning and the camera is very light and easy to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rothko

customer_reviews.title: Simply stunning camera
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best camera I have ever used. All I can say about the viewfinder for those that haven't tried it, imagine sitting in the middle row of a cinema and that's very similar to what it is like. Amazing in all respects. great build. very easy interface, amazing performance and great compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Thais

customer_reviews.title: Great walk about camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I had wanted something small enough to cary in a small bag, but that would take amazing shots with great color and great low light capabilities. And that could capture action shots. This camera fit the bill. I have no problem shooting it at over 3000 iso and getting fast moving shots. The images are beautiful and it really is small enough to take with me almost everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel_geek

customer_reviews.title: An excellent camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a X-E1 about a year before and found it to be a very versatile camera capable of shooting outstanding images. The X-T1 is an improvement in just about every way. It focuses quickly, has great high ISO performance, and is supported by a line of terrific lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality and a fantastic EVF
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality and a fantastic EVF. It's like looking through a window into a different world. What really makes this an amazing camera though is the external controls. No more racking your memory to remember how to change a setting, it's all right in front of you. It will change your view of digital cameras forever.
customer_reviews.author: D. Laing

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera for people on the go
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera a couple of weeks before we went on a European Grand Tour, and it was a dream to carry around and took gorgeous pictures. I am never going back to mirrors! This is a great camera for people on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: ... of these 6 months ago to see if i liked it. I can't believe the quality of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I rented one of these 6 months ago to see if i liked it. I can't believe the quality of the fine j pegs. The camera is a bit on the small side, when I'm used to my canon5d mark ll. But i think It's a great camera. Can't wait for my shoot coming up with my sons girl friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce N Maes

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. That's pretty much all there is to it. More MP would be nice. But I'll live. I don't even lug my 5D MK-III around any more. I've carried this camera over 100 miles thorough mountains of CO and CA. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: SML

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and lens. Way more photo power than I need.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for everything but sports.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful design, as I have been shooting since the 60's and relate to manual control of major functions. The images have great detail and color. The only thing it isn't is a sports shooter. Despite the claims, the autofocus just isn't adequate for a basketball or ice hockey game, and the lens selection doesn't include the long lenses needed for field sports. However the low-light performance and light weight make it ideal for travel, scenic, weddings and excursions into dimly lit music venues. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: High Acutance

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Nothing really unique to comment but having owned the X-E2 and being familiar with all Fuji models: Current best of the X series, new viewfinder is indeed nice, center mounting makes portrait shots easier when using tripod. Camera is much more sleek than XE-2, but not any smaller (wt is actually more). Directional buttons ARE too soft as is commonly known. Dials are great unless you're pulling the camera in and out of a pack, at which point they will move on ya. Nice upgrade over X-E2 as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Betcher

customer_reviews.title: I also have the X30 which is a favorite and the X100S
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera 15 months ago. I also have the X30 which is a favorite and the X100S. Recently, with delicate handling and relatively low usage the entire motherboard failed (blue disease). Therefore I would suggest that if you really want this camera be careful with your warranty as Fujifilm was not willing to do anything after a year had elapsed. Get an extended warranty or get the X30.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Fuisz

customer_reviews.title: Fuji XT-1 is a great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great photos and excellent 18-13mm lens. JPGs straight out of the camera have excellent color rendition and sharpness. Raw format requires software supplied with the camera. The JPGs are so good that shooting in the raw format is less necessary. This is a great camera that isn't much larger than a point and shoot camera. Would strongly recommend for portrait and landscape photos. It is a good camera for fast action sports, but there are better cameras on the market for capturing fast action sports events. If I had to choose one camera for travel photography, this camera with the 18-135mm lens would be that camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Alan Pressley

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, especially for those of us who like ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, especially for those of us who like the dials on top! Have an XE-2, but this is a lot more camera. Enjoying the learning curve!
customer_reviews.author: Tacoma girl

customer_reviews.title: Best Fuji "X" Camera to Date
customer_reviews.text: I've been a long time user of the Fuji X-series cameras (X100, X100s,X-Pro1, X-E1, X-E2). This is the BEST one yet, no question about it in my mind. Solid build, excellent viewfinder, responsive manual controls, very good image quality, etc. The X-T1 delivers a synergistic quality that is hard to describe. Feels right, works well, and is a joy to use. For the price, it has to be one of the best bargains out there for the serious photographer. I can't think of anything even close, with the possible exception of the Olympus OMD-1, which admittedly is in the same league.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Fe Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera a few weeks ago and love it. I'm still learning to use it properly and have a way to go to feel really comfortable with it. The colors on my photos are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Lady

customer_reviews.title: I love the camera and have no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought Fuji X-T1 With the !8-55mm F @.8-$.0 lens. I love the camera and have no complaints . It performs well and takes excellent pictures with the 18-55mm lens. However the aperture ring on this lens is too lose and easily moved by my left supporting hand. I had to find a wide rubber band to slip onto the barrel and part over the aperture ring . Now the aperture ring can be turned with a little resistance and it stays in place. Next time I buy a Fuji lens with an aperture ring, I will test it first. Otherwise I am very pleased with my Fuji gear.
customer_reviews.author: W. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Essentially a small pro camera
customer_reviews.text: In looking for a small light weight camera to replace all of my heavy DSLR equipment, I looked at a number of brands, read a number of reviews and decided on the X-T1. It is a fantastic camera. No need to say more as there are so many others who have commented on the features of this camera. The X mount lenses are superb. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: georgehd

customer_reviews.title: It's fun to shoot again.
customer_reviews.text: Buy one and get out there are shoot. It's a joy to use, unlike any DSLR I've run across. Smallish, stylish, and inviting. It begs to be used and that's what you'll do with it.
customer_reviews.author: ThePhen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has very good design, the images come out excellent. I like the big EVF, clear and bright. It works the same pro DSLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and hefty quality. Takes a bit getting used to after being a 30+ year Nikon fan. Size and weight are well balanced. Only complaint is small detached flash unit. Exposures with this little flash are unreliable and it is only useful within 10 feet. Feels too fragile to leave attached while walking about, and not very convenient to always carry separately for fill flash. Would have been better to have a small pop up unit as many other models have. Great low light sensitivity. Wifi works well with an ipad mini. Had to decide between this and a Nikon D610 and am 90% certain I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The XT1 is an excellent camera. I was worried the focusing would be an issue, but it's actually very fast and accurate. The body is solid and the controls are small but quite good. Battery life is not good, but probably the same as other cameras in this category. It's a great size for travel also.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the outcome of pictures I took during the National Park Loop.
customer_reviews.author: Anaud King

customer_reviews.title: I believe this will be the best camera i have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking pictures of family and outdoors for over 68 years and, I believe this will be the best camera i have ever used. Lenses are so very sharp,i will have a lot of cameras and lenses to sell. I love it more then my Nikon D600 full frame. Thanks Fujifilm. Bob
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Stavick

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Enough said... Great build, I could go on and on...
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I liked it but it was still surprisingly heavy with the smallish zoom lens that was with it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! got it from the Amazon warehouse and everything ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! got it from the Amazon warehouse and everything was brand new! the box was a bit scuffed but everything inside was perfect! couldn't be happier..
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Cortez

customer_reviews.title: No mirror? No problem.
customer_reviews.text: Who needs a mirror when you have the X-T1. A travel-size camera with the power of most high-end DSLRs. Colors are as accurate as you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Nikola Kolev

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera
customer_reviews.text: Well the Fuji XT1 has replaced my Leica M8, mainly for its high ISO capabilities. I have not been a fan of cameras that have deep menus, but Fuji's menus are pretty straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Roylance

customer_reviews.title: ... has fuzzy / snow in the viewfinder that is annoying. Otherwise it works well
customer_reviews.text: Used model - has fuzzy / snow in the viewfinder that is annoying. Otherwise it works well. The snow doesnt appear in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: FUGI X T1 a great camera
customer_reviews.text: A great small camera that reminds me of those I used back in the 80s. The result are wonderful and its size means I can take it every where, great for travel and people shots.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Best choice I've made
customer_reviews.text: I left dslrs for mirrorless. Best choice I've made. Small and compact. Great image quality
customer_reviews.author: Rene z

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Image Making Tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer of 8 years shooting weddings, family, and boudoir. I will simply say that I sold my Nikon D3 and all it's beautiful, heavy lenses and have completely shifted all my eggs to the Fuji basket based on this camera and Fuji's arsenal of amazing primes. My brain and my back are super happy with the decision.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Rust

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera, but my exposure compensation dial doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mayco sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Bye Canon, Hello Fujifilm!
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera! Sold the full frame Canon set up to switch into a lighter set up for traveling and less hassle. Definitely not as intimidating for taking shots of people while traveling instead of the paparazzi Canon set up. Glad I made the switch! Very capable camera and I'm looking forward to the new lens releases in their line-up. However, the kit lens has been fantastic! The dial controls are a nice touch as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Miller

customer_reviews.title: REALLY great. Such great images and color rendition is ridiculously ...
customer_reviews.text: REALLY great. Such great images and color rendition is ridiculously dead-on in varied lighting conditions that flummox other brands image processors (sony, canon, etc). I'm not sure who's working the image-processing magic over at Fuji but they deserve serious recognition.
customer_reviews.author: Pit

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Switched over from Nikon. I'm a believer. The Fuji lens lineup is awesome. Happy to be traveling lighter!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Smooth

customer_reviews.title: Love my X-t1
customer_reviews.text: Love my X-t1! I was using a friend one and had to get my own! So glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I just love this camera. The design is perfect, and it's easy to carry with!
customer_reviews.author: LuoLin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera with lots of cool features. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Giannetti

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been saving for this camera for a long time. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: A great mirrorless camera
customer_reviews.text: I'll make this short and sweet. I purchased this camera as an alternative to my Canon DSLR. The performance was great and the build quality is amazing. However it was returned due to two (personal) reasons. It was a bit small for my liking and I simply cant get used to an EVF. I used it for a few days continuously and the combination of smaller form factor and EVF were enough not to be dedicated to this system. I would have to say tough in all other aspects this camera is phenomenal performer, and IMHO the best mirror-less camera available today.
customer_reviews.author: Emaphoto

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Why would you want a big DSLR to carry around when you could have the X-T1. Mirrorless cameras at this level are replacing DLSR cameras. All the control and all the quality in a scale the is much more usable. I'm very happy with the quality. If you are looking for a very high megapixel camera in the 20s, then you might want to reevaluate what makes an amazing picture.
customer_reviews.author: P. Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: I used to carry Canon DSLR with heavy lenses. Since I purchase this camera, my trip is a lot easier. Picture quality is as good as DSLR but it is a lot lighter and smaller. I highly recommend this camera to anybody but who need to take videos.
customer_reviews.author: DO

customer_reviews.title: A new version of the Fuji X cameras.
customer_reviews.text: This is a new evolution in cameras. It is a computer that allows you to preview the photo that you will make before you trip the shutter. There are many surprises and they are all pleasant surprises. It is now Oct. 15 and I am still a great fan of this camera. It makes great images. I would like to have the technology in my Canon system.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull compact and crisp
customer_reviews.text: Great camera even if a little dated. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing camera. I love everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Grecco de Leon

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the view from this camera?
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera with, clear, crisp photos. Somewhat involved to operate...more for experienced or advanced photographers.
customer_reviews.author: nanci mancinelli

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say really - very, very good. I have the X100s and the Nikon D600. They all have their uses but the X-T1 fits very nicely in-between. The pictures are great straight from the camera (better than D600 in many cases and never worse (ok, with very high ISO it is worse)). Only negative is the exposure compensation button that can too easily be changed accidentally. The "kit" lens is also very good!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: APS wonder
customer_reviews.text: This camera reminds me of my old Yashica FX3. Small, light and easy to use. But with the electronics, the customizability it is certainly far superior to that manual camera i first had over 25 years ago. If you set it up, hardly needs any post processing. This camera has me excited about photography again!
customer_reviews.author: Afridi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Does everything my Canon 50D can do and I am able to carry it everywhere with ease. Love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Lightweight, easy to use, great images. It's the size of a street photographer's camera but with the quality of a larger professional camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. Plourde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Images from this camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Images from this camera. Though the video f---ing sucks. Fix the video FUJI! The Exposure dial changes in my bag all the time though. Its the only dial with out a button. The lock out buttons you should be able to switch on and off. Perhaps they will fix this in the next version.
customer_reviews.author: matajuro

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this camera. I have had a fuji xe-1 since Day One, and so I was delighted to get this XT-1. Unfortunately, the Zoom Playback dial (rear command wheel) worked for a week and then stopped working at all, so back it went. I didn't care about the light leak problems, but this defect made my camera nonfunctional since, in addition to zoom playback, this wheel also controls , among other things depending on how you have the dial configured in camera setup, intermediate shutter speeds. Anyway, I will probably reorder it, but I may wait awhile to see what comes out as the new X Pro2 first. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Beck

customer_reviews.title: ... have a couple of these and consider them the best mirrorless camera for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these and consider them the best mirrorless camera for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Champ

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! That's about all I can say as others have offered more complete reviews of this cameras features. The image quality is fantastic, the camera is far more compact than my Nikon DSLR's, and the electronic viewfinder is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: MM

product_meta.title: Fujifilm X-T1 16 MP Mirrorless Digital Camera with 3.0-Inch LCD (Body Only) (Weather Resistant) (Old Model)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseThe New Fujifilm X-T1 is the lasted professional quality camera body to join the ever expanding X-Series family. The X-T1 features the following: APS-C 16M X-Trans CMOS II Sensor and EXR Processor II, 2.36 Million Pixel OLED, High Magnification .77x - 31 Degree angle of view - Display lag 0.005 sec, Weather Resistant (When used with a weather resistant Fusion lens) - Water and Dust resistant, Freeze resistant to -10 Degree / 14 Degree, Tilt 3.0-Inch1040K pixel LCD Screen, Continuous Shooting - 8fps with Tracking AF. The camera also features 5 analog dials - Shutter speed, EV Compensation, ISO, Drive and Metering Mode.
feature_bullets: 16.3 MP APS-C X-Trans II CMOS sensor
Water and dust resistant and freezeproof to -14C/+14F with weather resistant lenses
OLED viewfinder with 100% coverage and 2,360,000 dots
Built-in Wi-Fi connectivity and remote camera control via smartphone

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars319 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
